intro: Braconotia acuta, commonly known as the acute braconotia, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and produces small, white to pale yellow flowers. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Braconotia acuta is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
